p.s: When researching about Shakespeare and his connection to my home country Germany, I came across this very interesting newspaper article on how he first became known in Germany.

There have been some of his influence in the works of Goethe or Herder, but Shakespeare only truly made his way into Germany with a germanGerman writer Christoph Martin Wieland's translations.
Between 1762 and 1766, Wieland published translation of 22 of Shakespeare's dramas.
